bestBHT.bht: The accusers have made mere assertions without providing any proof to support their allegations against Paul. Though Paul doesn't have a hired lawyer, he has skillfully defended himself and made a compelling case for his freedom. He challenges his accusers to prove the charges of sedition and disturbance, but they are unable to do so. Their accusations lack substance, and they are unable to shed light or demonstrate the truth behind their claims.

Albert Barnes: Neither can they prove the things ... That is, that I am a mover of sedition, or a disturber of the peace of the people.
This appeal he boldly makes; he challenges investigation.
As they did not offer to specify any acts of disorder or tumult excited by him, this charge falls of course.
Archibald T. Robertson: They have made 'charges,' mere assertions. They have not backed up these charges with proof, 'nor can they,' says Paul."
Paul has no hired lawyer to plead for him, but he has made a masterly plea for his freedom.
John Gill: Neither can they prove the things whereof they now accuse me.
they could not set forth in any clear light, and bring testimonies, or give demonstration of
they could not make them appear to be true, which it lay upon them to do

bhtAttempts.bht: The accusers in Acts 24:13 have launched baseless charges against Paul without any evidence to support their claims. Paul, though lacking a hired lawyer, presents a compelling argument for his freedom. He boldly challenges his accusers to prove the accusations of sedition and disturbance, but they fail to offer any concrete examples of his supposed wrongdoing. Their accusations remain unsubstantiated, highlighting their inability to present any clear light or demonstrate the truth behind their claims.

The accusers in this passage have made charges against Paul without providing any proof to back up their assertions. Paul, despite not having a hired lawyer, has presented a strong plea for his freedom. He challenges his accusers to substantiate the claims of sedition and disturbance, but they are unable to do so. Their accusations lack evidence, and they fail to shed any light or demonstrate the truth behind their allegations.

The accusers have made mere assertions without providing any proof to support their allegations against Paul. Though Paul doesn't have a hired lawyer, he has skillfully defended himself and made a compelling case for his freedom. He challenges his accusers to prove the charges of sedition and disturbance, but they are unable to do so. Their accusations lack substance, and they are unable to shed light or demonstrate the truth behind their claims.

Paul's accusers have made charges against him without presenting any evidence to support their claims. Paul, although without a hired lawyer, has pleaded masterfully for his freedom. He dares his accusers to prove his alleged involvement in sedition and disturbance, yet they are unable to provide concrete examples of his wrongdoing. As such, their baseless accusations remain unsubstantiated, as they fail to shed light or demonstrate the truth behind their claims.

The accusations against Paul in Acts 24:13 are merely assertions without any backing proof. He utilizes his skills to make a powerful plea for his freedom, even without a hired lawyer. Paul challenges his accusers to demonstrate and prove his alleged sedition and disturbance, yet they are unable to present any clear evidence or testimonies to substantiate their claims. Hence, their accusations lack credibility and fail to establish the truth, exposing their inability to provide substantial support.
